Package com.ibm.vie.mazerunner.squares

package com.ibm.vie.mazerunner.squares
This package contains the different square types used on a board. When interacting with a board, the IBoard.getSquareAt(com.ibm.vie.mazerunner.Location) returns an ISquare type which can be used to check
  • how many times you've stepped on the square.
  • how many steps it will cost to move to the square.
  • if you can move to the square based on your current position.
  • the type of square using the ISquare.getTypeString() method.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.ibm.vie.mazerunner
    This package provides the objects and methods needed to interact with the game.
  • Class
    Description
    Bushes
    A square full of bushes is moderately difficult to traverse.
    ISquare
    The top-level interface students will call to find out information about a square.
    Lava
    A square full of lava is difficult to traverse.
    Mountain
    A square full of mountains is difficult to traverse.
    Mud
    A square full of mud is fairly easy to traverse.
    Space
    An open square which costs only one step to traverse.
    Treasure
    A square containing a treasure chest.
    Trees
    A square full of trees is moderately difficult to traverse.
    Wall
    An impassible square -- players who traverse into one will lose all their steps.
    Water
    A square full of water is fairly easy to traverse.
